intro: Ammogeton, commonly known as the white sand or sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Ammogeton is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
